result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reggie Dante Smith

records.addlTxt: The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 12/02/2022.

Defendant Reggie Dante Smith not in court.  Attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.

Defendant Reggie Dante Smith not in court. 
Court allowing time for Defendant to appear in person. Case adjourned back to Out of Custody Court, Safety Building Room 221.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 10-04-2022.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Reggie Dante Smith not in court.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-30-2022 @1p
